title: 114_hr3284
content: The Act titled "Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2015" establishes a patient registry for mesothelioma data collection and research under Title III of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will develop a patient registry to collect data on mesothelioma in the United States. The registry will be used to track epidemiology, report on patient health information, describe disease incidence, facilitate research, and examine associated factors. The Secretary will establish a patient registry to gather data on mesothelioma in the United States, including demographic factors and occupational risks associated with the disease. The registry aims to provide information for research, prevention, and treatment of mesothelioma. The Secretary will establish a patient registry to gather data on mesothelioma in the United States, including risk factors, diagnosis markers, and outcomes measures. Consultation with experts in epidemiology and national associations focusing on mesothelioma will be conducted. The Secretary will establish a patient registry for mesothelioma, involving experts in research, care, information technology, clinicians, and research scientists. Information from the registry will be shared with federal agencies and made available to the public, ensuring privacy. The Secretary will ensure stringent privacy and security protections for the mesothelioma patient registry, in line with HIPAA laws. Reports to Congress will detail findings, future plans, and partnerships with research and patient advocacy communities. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress after 4 years of enacting the Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2015. The report will cover the development and maintenance of the mesothelioma patient registry, the type of information collected, its use and availability, and the coordination of databases storing mesothelioma information.
